abstract: South Korean Pres Lee Myung-bak says in his memoir that he rejected North Korea's demands for $10 billion aid package in exchange for talks in 2009, because he wanted to break pattern of rewarding North simply for agreeing to talk; book is scheduled for publication in February 2015.
lead_paragraph: In a new memoir, Lee Myung-bak, the South’s president from 2008 to 2013, writes that Kim Jong-il pressed hard for a meeting but demanded, among other things, $10 billion in cash.
snippet: In a new memoir, Lee Myung-bak, the South’s president from 2008 to 2013, writes that Kim Jong-il pressed hard for a meeting but demanded, among other things, $10 billion in cash.

headline.main: North Korea Sought Talks and Attached a Hefty Price Tag, South’s Ex-Leader Says
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Ex-Leader Reveals North’s Cash Request
